species_data.description: Compilation of Species for Star Wars SAGA Edition.

species_list.name: Advozse

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense

species_list.description_general: The Advozsec (singular: Advozse) are a humanoid alien race native to the volcanic world of Riflor. Characterized by their short stature, large black eyes, pointed ears, and a single horn on their almost hairless heads, they are adapted to a harsh environment with dim light. Advozsec are strict vegetarians and can become ill from consuming meat. Their culture is marked by a pessimistic and skeptical outlook. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Aleena

special_qualities.name: Nimble
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Acrobatics check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Quick Energy
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, an Aleena can gain a temporary boost to quickness and reflexes. When this ability is activated as a swift action, an Aleena gains a +2 bonus on Dexterity-based skill checks and increases its speed to 8 squares. The energy lasts for a number of rounds equal to the Aleena's Constitution modifier (minimum 1 round). When the energy is expended, the Aleena moves -1 persistent step along the condition track. The penalties imposed by this condition persist until the Aleena takes at least 10 minutes to recuperate, during which time the creature can't engage in any strenuous activity.

effects.recovery_note: Removed after 10 minutes of recuperation (no strenuous activity).

species_list.description_general: Aleena are a species of small, reptilian sentient beings from the planet Aleen Minor. They are noted for their short limbs, elongated crania, wide mouths with small, sharp teeth, and exceptionally fast metabolisms and reflexes, which help them escape predators. Aleena are known for their curiosity and often travel the galaxy in family groups. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Amanin

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: Amanin do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at 1st level, even if their class normally grants those feats

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Reach
special_qualities.description: Amanin have a natural reach of 2 squares

special_qualities.name: Resilient
special_qualities.description: Amanin gain a +1 species bonus to their Fortitude Defense due to their natural resilience

special_qualities.name: Roll
special_qualities.description: When using the run action, Amanin may roll into a ball to move at greater speed. When rolling, Amanin take a â€“5 penalty on Perception checks, but their speed is doubled.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Expert Climber)
special_qualities.description: Due to their arboreal background, Amanin may choose to take 10 on Climb checks even when distracted or threatened

species_list.description_general: The Amanin (singular: Amani), sometimes called Amanaman, are a tall, arboreal species from Maridun, characterized by long arms, short legs, and yellow-and-green skin. Their heads resemble hooded cobras with humanoid faces. Traditionally primitive, they often use spears and arrows and have a cultural aversion to advanced technology, though they are increasingly integrated into galactic society. Amanin are known for their resilience and preference for rolling into a ball to move at high speeds. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Anzati

special_qualities.name: Hunter's Instincts
special_qualities.description: Stealth and Survival are class skills for you.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Mesmerize
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, you can make a special attack against the Will Defense of a single target, within 6 squares. The attack modifier is equal to your character level plus your CHA modifier. If the attack succeeds, the target loses its standard action for the next turn. If it fails, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting effect.

effects.on_success_effect: target loses its standard action for the next turn
effects.on_failure_effect: target is immune to this effect for 24 hours

special_qualities.name: Presence Sense
special_qualities.description: When making a Survival check to track a living creature, you gain a species bonus equal to the quarry's Force Point total.

effects.description: Gain a species bonus to Survival checks to track a living creature equal to the quarry's Force Point total.

special_qualities.name: Soup Drinking
special_qualities.description: As a swift action once/round, you can use your proboscii to drain energy from a grabbed target, moving the target -1 step on the condition track as a persistent condition and granting you bonus hit points equal to 5 + half your level. You can repeat this action each round until the target escapes the grab or is rendered unconscious. If the target survives the feeding attempt, the persistent condition is removed after the target rests for 8 hours.

effects.repeatable_condition: each round until target escapes grab or is unconscious

species_list.description_general: The Anzati are a mysterious and feared near-human species, visually distinguished by bulbous noses and retractable proboscises hidden in their cheeks. They are known for their vampiric nature, feeding on the 'soup' (life essence or brain matter) of other beings using their proboscises. Anzati possess natural Force sensitivity, often manifesting as telepathic abilities to hypnotize prey, and are exceptionally skilled in stealth, making them formidable assassins. [Web Sources: ScreenRant, Reddit r/MawInstallation]

species_list.name: Aqualish

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Toughness as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Breathe Underwater
special_qualities.description: You cannot drown in water.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened.

species_list.description_general: The Aqualish are tusked, amphibious humanoids from Ando, often seen as aggressive and crude. They have three subspecies: Aquala (finned hands, two eyes), Quara (clawed, five-fingered hands, two eyes), and Ualaq (fingered hands, often four eyes for varied vision). The fingered types are more technologically adept. Their society is marked by internal strife and a history of conflict. [Web Sources: Holocron - Star Wars Combine, World Anvil]

species_list.name: Arcona

special_qualities.name: Great Fortitude
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

species_list.description_general: Arcona are scaleless reptilian humanoids from the ammonia-rich, arid world of Cona. They have flat, anvil-shaped heads, large multifaceted eyes (often green or gold if addicted to salt), and a keen sense of smell via their tongues. Their society is family-based, with males typically raising the young due to the females' more reckless nature. Arcona are known for their susceptibility to salt addiction, which acts as a hallucinogen. [Web Sources: SWSE Miraheze, Imperial Shipyards]

species_list.name: Arkanian

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Flash of Genius
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter add a +5 circumstance bonus to the result of one Knowledge, Mechanics or Use Computer skill check.

special_qualities.name: Intellectual Reputation
special_qualities.description: You can use your INT bonus instead of your CHA bonus on Persuasion checks.

species_list.description_general: Arkanians are a near-human species from the frigid world of Arkania, known for their extreme intelligence, arrogance, and contributions to genetics and technology. They have solid white eyes capable of infrared vision, four-clawed digits, and often engage in self-experimentation. Their society values scientific advancement, sometimes leading to a reputation as 'mad scientists'. [Web Source: SW5E.com]

species_list.name: Arkanian Offshoot

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Gain the Skill Focus feat for one of the following skills in which you are trained: Endurance, Mechanics, Pilot, Survival, Treat Injury.

special_qualities.name: Determination
special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, they can reroll one failed skill check with a trained skill. This reroll can be declared after the success or failure of the roll is known. The Arkanian offshoot must take the result of the second roll. A skill check is considered a failure only when the check fails to meet the minimum DC for any kind of success.

species_list.description_general: Arkanian Offshoots are a subspecies genetically engineered by Arkanian scientists, often for specific industrial tasks like mining. They differ physically from pureblood Arkanians, typically having five fingers and sometimes varied skin tones or ear shapes. Offshoots are generally less hardy and shorter-lived. While some purebloods view them as tools or slaves, others see them as victims of corporate greed. They tend to be confident in their abilities but lack the arrogance of pureblood Arkanians. [Web Sources: SWSE Miraheze, World Anvil]

species_list.name: Balosar

special_qualities.name: Antennapalps
special_qualities.description: While his antennapalps are extended, a Balosar can reroll a Perception check involving sound but must keep the second result. A Balosar may choose to retract his antennapalps as a free action (extending them is likewise a free action) to pass as human (no Deception check required).

special_qualities.name: Moral Ambiguity
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to Will Defense against Deception and Persuasion checks.

special_qualities.name: Poison Resistance
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to Fortitude Defense against poisons.

species_list.description_general: Balosars are humanoids from the polluted world of Balosar, distinguished by retractable antennapalps on their skulls. These organs grant them a form of physical intuition by detecting subsonic frequencies and emotional surges, often mistaken for Force sensitivity. Due to their toxic homeworld, Balosars have a natural resistance to many poisons and toxins, which unfortunately makes them able to consume large quantities of death sticks, though they are not immune to addiction. They often appear gaunt compared to humans. [Web Source: World Anvil]

species_list.name: Barabel

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, teeth or tail, dealing 1d6 slashing, piercing or bludgeoning damage respectively.

effects.notes: Can also use teeth (1d6 piercing) or tail (1d6 bludgeoning).

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: You do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at first level, even if your class normally grants them.

effects.notes: Does not gain these as starting feats even if class normally grants them.

special_qualities.name: Radiation Resistance
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense to resist the effect of radiation; never gain persistent condition from the effects of radiation.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Intimidation)
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Persuasion check made to intimidate others, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Stun Resistance
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your damage threshold to resist stun damage.

species_list.description_general: Barabel are a bipedal, reptilian species from Barab I, covered in tough, dark keratinous scales that offer protection. They possess retractable claws, sharp teeth, and can shed their tails. Adapted to their harsh, irradiated homeworld, they hunt at night and have excellent darkvision. Barabel society is known for its hunting culture and mean-spirited aggression, though they are fiercely loyal to family. They hold Jedi in high esteem due to a historical intervention that settled a long civil war. [Web Source: Holocron - Star Wars Combine]

species_list.name: Bith

special_qualities.name: Evolved Intellect
special_qualities.description: Whenever a Bith spends a Force Point for any reason, the Bith gains a temporary Force Point that must be spent to add to an Intelligence-based skill check. If the temporary Force Point has not been used by the end of the encounter, it is lost.

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Meditative Trance
special_qualities.description: You can enter a trance that lasts 4 hours, after which you gain the benefits of having rested for 8 hours.

effects.effect_description: Enter a 4-hour trance to gain benefits of 8 hours rest.

special_qualities.name: Scent
special_qualities.description: At close range (within 10 squares), you ignore concealment and cover for purposes of Perception checks, and you take no penalty from poor visibility when tracking.

species_list.description_general: Bith are highly intelligent, ancient craniopods from Bith, known for their large, hairless heads, black lidless eyes, and long fingers. They possess acute hearing and smell, with olfactory organs in their cheek flaps. Bith society is highly regimented and technologically advanced, with a deep cultural history. They are often skilled musicians (like the Modal Nodes), artists, and programmers, but are physically frail and particularly sensitive to sonic attacks. [Web Sources: SWSE Miraheze, SW5E.com]

species_list.name: Blood Carver

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Acrobatics) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Acrobatics skill.

special_qualities.name: Deathstrike
special_qualities.description: You deal +1 die of damage to an opponent denied its DEX bonus to Reflex Defense when you hit with a melee attack.

species_list.description_general: Blood Carvers are a fearsome, slender near-Human species from the planet Batorine known for their ritualistic combat and ancestor worship. They possess pale skin, pointed ears, and sharp claws, often adorning themselves with tattoos and piercings. Blood Carvers are highly agile and train rigorously in bladed combat, viewing battle as a sacred art. Their culture is deeply rooted in tradition and honor, with a complex social hierarchy. [Web Source: SWSE Miraheze]

species_list.name: Bothan

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Gather Information) if you are trained in the Gather Information skill.

special_qualities.name: Iron Will
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Will Defense.

species_list.description_general: Bothans are furry, mammalian humanoids from Bothawui, renowned throughout the galaxy as master spies and information brokers. They possess keen senses, particularly smell and hearing, and their culture emphasizes political maneuvering, intelligence gathering, and subtlety. Bothans are known for their intricate spy network (the Bothan Spynet) and their crucial role in acquiring sensitive information. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Caamasi

special_qualities.name: Adept Diplomat
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Persuasion check, keeping the better result.

special_qualities.name: Memory Sharing (Memnii)
special_qualities.description: Caamasi can create strong, lasting memories and share them with others of their species through an inborn telepathy. Sharing a memory begins with taking a full-round action to initiate the link between two adjacent Caamasi; transferring a memory requires as much time as the events being recalled. The recipient of a memory must be willing to receive it. Experiencing memniiis not like receiving a photographic memory of those events, but rather a complete, immersive experience. Any character who receives a memnis from a Caamasi always gains favorable circumstances on Knowledge checks related to that memory. Force-using characters can also receive memnii from a Caamasi with a successful DC 15 Use the Force check, made as a reaction.

effects.notes: Immersive experience, not photographic memory. Transfer time equals duration of recalled events.

special_qualities.name: Pacifism
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, a Caamasi can make a Persuasion check against the Will Defense of a single target within line of sight. If the check is successful, the target moves -1 step along the condition track if it makes any attacks before the start of the Caamasi's next turn. The target must be able to hear and understand the Caamasi for this ability to have any effect, and any single target can be affected only once at any given time (meaning that multiple Caamasi may not use this ability on the same target at the same time). This is a mind-affecting effect.

species_list.description_general: The Caamasi are a highly respected avian-descended humanoid species known for their wisdom, pacifism, and ability to share vivid memories called 'memnii'. They possess golden fur, avian features, and a gentle demeanor. Their homeworld, Caamas, was devastated, leading to a diaspora and a deep cultural emphasis on peace and reconciliation. Caamasi are often sought as mediators and diplomats. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Cathar

special_qualities.name: Cathar Instincts
special_qualities.description: Climb and Stealth are class skills for Cathar.

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Reactive Claw
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter when you damage an opponent in melee, you can make a single melee attack with a claw against that target as a swift action if you have a free hand.

species_list.description_general: The Cathar are a species of feline humanoids from the planet Cathar, known for their warrior culture, loyalty, and retractable claws. They possess lion-like manes, powerful builds, and a strong connection to their traditions and prides. Cathar are skilled hunters and fighters, with a deep sense of honor and a history marked by resilience against enslavement and conflict. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Celegian

special_qualities.name: Broadcast Telepath
special_qualities.description: Celegians can use the Telepathy application of the Use the Force skill untrained, even if they do not possess the Force Sensitivity feat. A Celegian automatically succeeds on this check to communicate with willing targets within 60 squares of it and in its line of sight.

special_qualities.name: Cyanogen Breather (Life-Support Chamber)
special_qualities.description: Unless you are encased in a special environment chamber, you will suffocate. Ooroo's Life-support chamber: DR 10, +5 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense, increases fly speed by +2 squares.

special_qualities.name: Expert Swimmer
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Swim check, but you must accept the second result, and you can take 10 on Swim checks even when distracted or threatened.

species_list.description_general: Celegians are highly intelligent, crystalline brain-like beings from Celegia that float within protective, levitating life-support canisters. They communicate telepathically as they lack vocal organs and breathe a unique cyanogen gas mixture. Celegians are known for their advanced understanding of science and philosophy, often serving as scholars or advisors. Their unique physiology makes them reliant on their canisters for survival off their homeworld. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Cerean

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Initiative) if you are trained in the Initiative skill.

special_qualities.name: Intuitive Initiative
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Initiative check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Cereans are a sophisticated humanoid species from Cerea, distinguished by their tall conical craniums housing complex binary brains, allowing them to process thoughts on multiple levels simultaneously. They are known for their measured, thoughtful nature, often excelling in roles requiring deep concentration and foresight, such as Jedi or strategists. Cerean culture values harmony and balance, and they are generally peaceful but capable warriors when necessary. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Chadra-Fan

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Heightened Awareness
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Perception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Tinkerer
special_qualities.description: You have Mechanics as a class skill, you can choose to reroll any Mechanics check, but must accept the result of the reroll. Whenever you repair or jury-rig a droid or device with Mechanics check, it gains an additional 1d8 hit points.

species_list.description_general: Chadra-Fan are small, furry, rodent-like humanoids from Chad, possessing large ears, sensitive snouts, and excellent darkvision. They are known for their inquisitive nature, short attention spans, and remarkable aptitude for tinkering with technology and mechanics, often becoming skilled technicians or scavengers. Their society is communal, and they have a natural resistance to sleep-inducing agents. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.description: You can breathe normally in water.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Radiation Resistance
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense to resist the effect of radiation.

species_list.description_general: Chagrians are amphibious humanoids from the planet Champala, recognizable by their blue skin, large curving horns (lethorns), and head-tails. They are well-adapted to aquatic environments and possess low-light vision. Chagrian society is known for its strong sense of justice and order, and they often excel in roles requiring leadership and resilience. They are also noted for their resistance to radiation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision

species_list.description_general: The Chiss are a blue-skinned, red-eyed near-Human species from the Unknown Regions, hailing from the icy planet Csilla. They are known for their highly organized and disciplined society, the Chiss Ascendancy, which values intellect, strategy, and art. Chiss are often seen as aloof, calculating, and pragmatic. Their existence was long a mystery to the wider galaxy. [Web Sources: swtor.com, SWSE Miraheze]

species_list.name: Chiss

special_qualities.name: Bonus Trained Skill
special_qualities.description: You choose one additional trained skill.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.description_general: The Chiss are a blue-skinned, red-eyed near-Human species from the Unknown Regions, hailing from the icy planet Csilla. They are known for their highly organized and disciplined society, the Chiss Ascendancy, which values intellect, strategy, and art. Chiss are often seen as aloof, calculating, and pragmatic. Their existence was long a mystery to the wider galaxy. [Web Sources: swtor.com, SWSE Miraheze - Note: General description for Chiss; specific traits from F source should be prioritized if different.]

species_list.name: Chistori

special_qualities.name: Armor Plating
special_qualities.description: Chistori have thick scales that provide damage reduction 2.

special_qualities.name: Cold-Blooded
special_qualities.description: You take a -5 penalty to Fortitude Defense when exposed to extreme cold

special_qualities.name: Rage
special_qualities.description: Once/day you can fly into a rage as a swift action, temporarily gaining +2 rage bonus to melee attack rolls and damage rolls, but unable to use skills requiring concentration and patience; lasts 5 + Constitution rounds, and moves character -1 persistent step along the condition track until 10 minutes of relaxed recuperation have passed

species_list.description_general: The Chistori are a bipedal reptilian species known for their tough, scaly hides which provide natural armor. They are cold-blooded, which can make them vulnerable to extreme cold. Chistori are often depicted as aggressive and possessing a warrior culture, sometimes prone to fits of rage. [Web Source: Based on common reptilian species tropes and the traits provided in the user's data, general Star Wars fan wikis often describe similar species.]

species_list.name: Clawdite

special_qualities.name: Shapeshift
special_qualities.description: Clawdites are shapechangers and can alter their appearance at will. A Clawdite gains a +10 species bonus on Deception checks made to disguise appearance. Additionally, a Clawdite can disguise its appearance as a full-round action at no penalty.

effects.effect_description: Alter appearance at will with no penalty.

special_qualities.name: Startle
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a reaction to an attack, you can make a Deception check against the attacker's Will Defense to impose a -5 penalty on the attack roll

species_list.description_general: Clawdites are a humanoid reptilian species of shapeshifters from the planet Zolan. They can alter their physical appearance to mimic other humanoids of similar size and shape, a physically demanding process. This ability makes them natural spies and assassins. Their true forms are typically gaunt with large, dark eyes. Clawdite society is often secretive due to persecution for their unique abilities. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Clone, Republic

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain one bonus feat

special_qualities.name: Bonus Trained Skill
special_qualities.description: You choose one additional trained skill

species_list.description_general: Republic Clones, initially based on the template of Jango Fett, were genetically engineered soldiers bred for the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars. They were known for their combat prowess, loyalty, and accelerated aging. While bred for uniformity, individual clones often developed distinct personalities and specializations. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Codru-Ji

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Gains Dual Weapon Mastery as a bonus feat provided he or she meets the prerequisites of the feat (minimum Dexterity of 13 and a base attack bonus of + 1).

special_qualities.name: Extra Arms
special_qualities.description: Codru-Ji can hold up to four items or weapons at a time. This ability does not grant extra attacks; however, it does mean that a Codru-Ji can wield two two-handed weapons at a time.

special_qualities.name: Skilled Grappler
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to grab attacks

species_list.description_general: Codru-Ji are a four-armed humanoid species from Munto Codru. They are known for their fierce independence and a unique life cycle involving a larval 'wyrwulf' stage. As adults, Codru-Ji are skilled warriors and diplomats, often with a reputation for cunning and a strong sense of personal honor. Their extra arms grant them advantages in grappling and wielding multiple items. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Croke

special_qualities.name: Illusory Form
special_qualities.description: A Croke can hide its true appearance behind an illusion. As a swift action, it can appear as a Small or Medium creature that can vary in appearance depending on who views it, and it can maintain this illusion indefinitely. The illusion has no effect on the Croke's statistics. A creature can pierce the illusion by making a Perception or Use the Force check against the Croke's Will Defense as a standard action, but only while the Croke is stunned or unconscious. The illusion otherwise looks and feels absolutely real.

effects.effect_description: Can appear as a Small or Medium creature, maintained indefinitely. No effect on stats.
effects.pierce_illusion_check: Perception or Use the Force vs. Croke's Will Defense (Standard action)

special_qualities.name: Immune to vacuum
special_qualities.description: You are immune to the effects of vacuum

special_qualities.name: Species Bonus to Reflex Defense
special_qualities.description: Gains a +1 species bonus to Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Species Bonus to Will Defense
special_qualities.description: Gains a +1 species bonus to Will Defense.

species_list.description_general: Croke are diminutive, snail-like sentients from Crakull, known for their potent illusions and their ability to survive in vacuum. Their true forms are rarely seen due to their illusory capabilities, which can make them appear as other beings. They are often considered mysterious and can be deceptive. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, based on Croke traits]

species_list.name: Dashade

special_qualities.name: Environmental Adaptation
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense against the effects of extreme heat, extreme cold and radiation

special_qualities.name: Fearsome Reputation
special_qualities.description: You can reroll Persuasion checks made to intimidate another, keeping the better result

special_qualities.name: Force Resistance
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Fortitude and Will Defenses against any Use the Force checks

species_list.description_general: Dashade are a near-Human reptilian species from the planet Urkupp, known for their natural resistance to Force-based mind manipulation and their resilience to harsh environments. They possess tough hides and a reputation for being formidable warriors, often employed as mercenaries or bodyguards due to their physical prowess and Force resistance. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Defel

special_qualities.name: Partial Invisibility
special_qualities.description: When you are in shadowy illumination or darker conditions you are treated as having total concealment; you are fully visible and gain no concealment against opponents with darkvision

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment (UV Visor Requirement)
special_qualities.description: You require special goggles to see in normal light. Without such a visor, a Defel is considered blind (see "Blindness" on page 254 of the Saga Edition core rulebook). An ultraviolet visor costs 2,000 credits. A Defel character begins play with this item at no cost.

effects.starting_equipment_note: Begins play with this item at no cost.

species_list.description_general: Defel, also known as 'wraiths,' are lupine humanoids from the high-gravity, UV-light-deficient world of Af'El. They are visible only in ultraviolet light or specific sensor spectra, appearing as shadows in normal light, which grants them natural stealth. They require special visors to see in normal light conditions. Defel are known for their cunning and often work as assassins, spies, or bounty hunters. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Devaronian (females)

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

special_qualities.name: Natural Curiosity
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a standard action, you can make a Perception check against a single target within line of sight (DC 15 or the result of an opposed Stealth check); if successful, you gain a +1 insight bonus on attack rolls against that target.

species_list.description_general: Devaronians are a horned, humanoid species with distinct sexual dimorphism. Females are covered in fur, lack horns, and are generally more placid, intelligent, and industrious than males. They often manage businesses and households on Devaron. Off-world, female Devaronians might be merchants or scholars, known for their calm demeanor and sharp minds. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Devaronian (females)

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

Off-world, female Devaronians might be merchants or scholars, known for their calm demeanor and sharp minds. [Web Source: Wookieepedia - Note: General description for Devaronian females; specific traits from W source should be prioritized if different.]

species_list.name: Devaronian (males)

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

special_qualities.name: Natural Curiosity
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a standard action, you can make a Perception check against a single target within line of sight (DC 15 or the result of an opposed Stealth check); if successful, you gain a +1 insight bonus on attack rolls against that target.

species_list.description_general: Devaronians are a horned, humanoid species with distinct sexual dimorphism. Males possess sharp horns, pointed teeth, and a reputation for wanderlust, roguishness, and a love of adventure, often contrasting with the more settled nature of Devaronian females. Their physiology makes them resistant to many toxins. They are often found as smugglers, explorers, or spacers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat

species_list.name: Draethos

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Weapon Proficiency (advanced melee weapons) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Natural Telepath
special_qualities.description: Gain a +5 species bonus using the Telepathy aspect of the Use the Force skill and make untrained Use the Force checks to use Telepathy without the Force Sensitivity feat.

species_list.description_general: The Draethos are a tall, slender, long-lived reptilian species from the planet Draethos. They are known for their natural telepathic abilities, strong sense of community, and adherence to tradition. Draethos possess tough, leathery hides that provide natural armor and are skilled in the use of advanced melee weapons, reflecting their warrior heritage. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Droid, 1st degree, medium (medical/scientific)

special_qualities.name: Behavioral Inhibitors
special_qualities.description: Standard droid behavioral restrictions apply, except for 4th-degree droids.

effects.details: Standard behavioral inhibitor rules apply (cannot harm sentients, must obey owners within limits); heuristic processors allow interpretation. Fourth-degree droids often have modified restrictions.

special_qualities.name: Ion Damage Vulnerability
special_qualities.description: Droids are vulnerable to ion weapons.

effects.details: Vulnerable to ion weapons; effects similar to stun on living beings.

special_qualities.name: Maintenance
special_qualities.description: Droids require periodic recharging.

effects.details: Requires 1-hour recharge per 100 hours operation; failure incurs Endurance checks (DC 10 +1/hr) or -1 persistent condition track step per hour.

special_qualities.name: Nonliving
special_qualities.description: Droids are immune to effects targeting living beings and have no Constitution score.

special_qualities.name: Repair
special_qualities.description: Droids are repaired using the Mechanics skill.

special_qualities.name: Shut Down
special_qualities.description: Droids can be shut down, rendering them unconscious.

special_qualities.name: Skills
special_qualities.description: Droids have limitations on using skills untrained.

special_qualities.name: Systems
special_qualities.description: Droid characteristics can be modified with systems.

effects.details: Characteristics can be changed via system installation/replacement.

species_list.description_general: First-degree droids are characterized by their advanced intelligence and specialization in intellectual pursuits such as mathematics, science, and medicine. Medium-sized versions balance this intellect with a standard humanoid form factor. They often serve as doctors, researchers, or technical specialists. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, general droid classification]

Their size can be advantageous for navigating tight spaces or for specific support roles. [Web Source: Wookieepedia, general droid classification]

species_list.description_general: Medium-sized second-degree droids are typically engineered for technical and specialized tasks, such as astrogation, starship repair, computer interfacing, and general maintenance. Astromechs are a prime example, known for their versatility and problem-solving capabilities. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

This size allows them to fit into starfighter astromech sockets or navigate confined spaces. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

They are designed for social and service functions rather than technical or labor-intensive tasks. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

species_list.description_general: Medium fourth-degree droids are primarily designed for combat, security, and related aggressive roles. Their programming often features fewer behavioral inhibitions against violence compared to other droid degrees. They form the bulk of many droid armies and security forces. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

They operate with minimal behavioral inhibitors regarding aggression compared to other droid degrees. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

They typically possess robust frames and prioritize strength over complex reasoning or social interaction skills. These droids are common in industrial settings, construction, and freight handling. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

[Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications, e.g., Wookieepedia]

They are typically small, durable, and equipped with a variety of tools and sensors. Astromechs often form strong bonds with their owners and display distinct personalities. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.description_general: Battle droids are fourth-degree droids designed primarily for combat. They vary widely in design and capability, from standard infantry units like the B1-series to more specialized and heavily armed versions. While often numerous, individual units may lack advanced tactical processing or durability without centralized command. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

They prioritize strength and durability for physically demanding tasks, often with simple programming suited to repetitive actions. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications]

species_list.description_general: Service droids are third-degree droids designed to interact with and assist organic beings in various non-technical or non-labor roles. This broad category includes droids specialized in hospitality, childcare, sanitation, and other service industries. [Web Source: Based on general Star Wars droid classifications]

species_list.name: Dug

special_qualities.name: Athletic
special_qualities.description: A Dug can reroll any Climb or Jump check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse. In addition, a Dug can take 10 on Climb and Jump checks even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: A Dug that has Acrobatics as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Acrobatics) as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Dug Agility
special_qualities.description: The Dugs' natural environment makes them extremely agile. Dugs may reroll any Climb check or Jump check, but the result of the reroll must be accepted, even if it is worse.

special_qualities.name: Lightning Reflexes
special_qualities.description: Dugs gain a +2 species bonus to their Reflex Defense, accounting for their uncanny ability to avoid danger.

species_list.description_general: Dugs are a unique species from Malastare, characterized by their unusual locomotion: they walk on their long, powerful arms, using their legs and feet as hands. They have snouted faces, large ears, and a generally aggressive and ill-tempered demeanor. Dugs are known for their skill in podracing and their surprising agility despite their unconventional anatomy. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.description_general: Duros are a humanoid species with smooth blue-green skin, large red goggle-like eyes, and lipless mouths, hailing from the planet Duro. They are among the galaxy's earliest and most widespread spacefaring cultures, known for their innate piloting skills and love of exploration. Duros are often found as pilots, navigators, and explorers, contributing significantly to galactic hyperspace route mapping. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

The target must be within 6 squares of the Ebruchi, and the effect lasts until the end of the encounter. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Pheromones
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, you can make a special attack vs adjacent creature; the attack bonus = your character level + your CHA bonus; if the attack equals or exceeds the target's Fortitude Defense, the target moves -1 step on the condition track. If you fail, target is immune for 24h. If target reaches -5 CT, instead of falling unconscious, it becomes friendly. Pheromones function as an inhaled poison. Any creature holding its breath is unaffected (see the Endurance skill description on page 66 of the Saga Edition core rulebook). A creature can be affected by Falleen pheromones only once per round. Multiple exposures to pheromones from different Falleen in the same round produce no additional effects. A hostile creature cannot be targeted by this effect.

special_qualities.name: Bellow
special_qualities.description: As a standard action, an Ithorian can open all four of its throats and emit a terrible subsonic bellow. The Ithorian makes a special attack roll (ld20 + its character level) and compares the result to the Fortitude Defense of all creatures and unattended objects in a 6-square cone. A successful hit deals 3d6 points of sonic damage; if the attack misses, the target takes half damage instead. Each use of this ability moves the Ithorian -1 step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148). An Ithorian can choose to add more dice (d6s) to the damage it deals with its bellow, but each additional 1d6 of damage moves the Ithorian another-1 step along the condition track. You add the damage bonus from your heroic levels to this attack.

special_qualities.description: Whenever a Killik reduces a living creature with an Intelligence of 3 or higher to 0 hit points, or the Killik knocks the creature unconscious by moving it down the condition track, the Killik can transform the target into a Joiner. The target must be helpless for this to occur. The process takes 1 minute and exposes the target to mind-altering pheromones. Once the target becomes a Joiner, its attitude shifts to friendly to the Killik and its allies, and the target gains a + 10 bonus to Will Defense against attempts to use Persuasion to alter its perceptions of its new Killik friends. A target transformed into a Joiner in this manner can make a DC 20 Intelligence check once per day to remove the effect and return to its original attitude. This is a mind-affecting effect.

special_qualities.name: Force Sight
special_qualities.description: Although blind, Miraluka can "see" by using the Force. They act normally without taking any penalties for blindness when in the presence of living creatures or life of any kind. This trait enables them to make Perception checks, and read and write as a sighted person. They can ignore the effect of darkness as if they had darkvision. Miraluka cannot, however, detect creatures that are "invisible" to the Force such as the Yuuzhan Vong and the ysalamiri. These creatures have total concealment from Miraluka, as do creatures in areas that dampen or suppress the Force. Additionally, the Miraluka ignores all penalties to Perception checks from cover and concealment (but not total cover or total concealment). Miraluka do not increase the DC of Use the Force checks made to Sense Surroundings against targets with total cover.

special_qualities.description: Once per encounter, a Skakoan can make a standard action Mechanics or Use Computer check as a swift action.

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment
special_qualities.description: Skakoans suffer limitations outside their native atmosphere. Without a pressure suit (see below), a Skakoan takes 1d6 points of damage each round and begins to suffocate. Skakoan characters begin play with a light pressure suit at no cost.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Careful Worker
special_qualities.description: A Sluissi who takes twice the normal amount of time required to use the Mechanics skill gains a + 10 circumstance bonus to the Mechanics check.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Tech Specialist as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Mechanics skill

special_qualities.name: Serpentine
special_qualities.description: You are always considered to have a running start for Jump checks and gain a +5 stability bonus when making grapple checks against the Trip feat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Cold Resistance
special_qualities.description: You add a +5 species bonus to Fortitude Defense to resist extreme cold

special_qualities.name: Observant
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter you can use your Perception bonus in place of your Deception or Persuasion bonus

special_qualities.name: Dark-Infused
special_qualities.description: You gain the Force Training feat for free, but half of the selected powers must have the (dark side) descriptor and none may have the (light side) descriptor

special_qualities.name: Repulsive Appearance
special_qualities.description: You may reroll Persuasion checks made to intimidate, keeping the better result, and you gain a +5 bonus to Will Defense to resist the Persuasion checks others make against you

special_qualities.name: Special Qualities
special_qualities.description: Each Sorcerer gains from one to three special qualities unique to his or her relationship with the Dark. Create these qualities, or select one or more using the Creature Generator on UR page 89.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Natural Diplomat
special_qualities.description: Persuasion is always a class skill for you and you gain a +5 species bonus to Persuasion checks made to haggle

special_qualities.name: Tech Savvy
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Knowledge (technology) checks, but you must accept the result of the reroll, and you are not limited to common knowledge when making an untrained Knowledge (technology) check (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Weapon Familiarity
special_qualities.description: You are proficient with the Squib tensor rifle if you have the Weapon Proficiency (rifles) feat

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill

special_qualities.name: Force Blind
special_qualities.description: Have lost the connection to the Force. Cannot take the Force Sensitivity feat. Can still increase Dark Side Score and are still affected by Force powers, talents, and the Use the Force skill as normal.

special_qualities.name: Keen Smell
special_qualities.description: When within 6 squares of a target in the same room or open area, you can reroll Persuasion checks against that target, keeping the best result

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: Any Stereb that has Mechanics as a trained skill gains Skill Focus (Mechanics) as a bonus feat. However, this bonus applies only when the Stereb character is working with stone.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: Stereb ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness. However, they cannot perceive colors in total darkness.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Primitive
special_qualities.description: Stereb do not gain Weapon Proficiency (pistols, rifles, or heavy weapons) as starting feats at 1st level, even if their class normally grants those feats

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Subterranean
special_qualities.description: Stereb are adapted to a subterranean life and can take 10 on Survival checks when in an underground environment, even when distracted or threatened.

special_qualities.name: Tough
special_qualities.description: Like the stone they work with, Stereb are physically hardened, gaining a +5 species bonus to their damage threshold and a +2 species bonus to their Fortitude Defense.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness

special_qualities.name: Armor Training
special_qualities.description: Taung characters increase the Maximum Dexterity bonus from worn armor by 1.

effects.summary: Mechanics are described textually in the description.

special_qualities.name: Superior Defenses
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 species bonus to all of your Defenses

special_qualities.name: Warrior Culture
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Knowledge (tactics) check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll)

special_qualities.name: Quadruped
special_qualities.description: You gain +5 bonus to all defenses against effects that trip or knock you prone

special_qualities.name: Multiple Personalities
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter as a free action at the start of your turn, you can negate or remove any mind-affecting effects

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor

species_list.name: Tof

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat (Choice)
special_qualities.description: You can take either Rapid Shot or Rapid Strike as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Mighty Swing as a bonus feat if you have Martial Arts 1 and a STR 13 or better.

special_qualities.name: Tof Fearlessness
special_qualities.description: Once/encounter you can ignore one fear-related or mind-affecting effect used against you; you have a +5 species bonus to your Will Defense when resisting attempts to intimidate you.

effects.effect_description: Ignore one fear-related or mind-affecting effect used against self.

species_list.description_general: The Tof were a green-skinned humanoid species from the planets Tof and Nagai, located beyond the Galactic Rim. They were known for their extreme xenophobia, militarism, and desire for conquest, engaging in a protracted war with the Nagai. Tof society was hierarchical and driven by a belief in their own superiority. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Togorian

special_qualities.name: Feline Reflexes
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 species bonus to your Reflex Defense.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Physically Intimidating
special_qualities.description: You use your STR bonus instead of your CHA bonus for Persuasion checks made to intimidate others.

species_list.description_general: Togorians are a large, feline humanoid species from the planet Togoria. They are known for their impressive strength, hunting prowess, and a culture that values honor and martial skill. Togorians possess retractable claws, sharp teeth, and a cat-like agility despite their size. Their society is often tribal, with a deep respect for tradition and warrior codes. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Togruta

special_qualities.name: Pack Hunter
special_qualities.description: You deal an extra 2 points of damage on melee attacks against opponents you flank.

special_qualities.name: Sneaky
special_qualities.description: You can choose to reroll any Stealth check to sneak, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Spatial Awareness
special_qualities.description: You ignore all cover and concealment when making Perception checks to notice targets within 10 squares.

species_list.description_general: Togruta are a sentient humanoid species from the planet Shili, known for their colorful skin patterns, large head-tails called lekku, and montrals (hollow horns) that grant a form of passive echolocation. They are often skilled hunters and warriors, with a strong connection to their community and natural environment. Togruta culture values unity and self-sufficiency. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Toydarian

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Deception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Deception skill.

special_qualities.name: Force Resistance (Mind-Affecting)
special_qualities.description: You gain a +5 species bonus to your Will Defense against any Use the Force checks with the mind-affecting descriptor.

species_list.description_general: Toydarians are a winged humanoid species from Toydaria, known for their resistance to Force-based mental influence and their shrewd business acumen. They possess small, pudgy bodies, snouts, and leathery wings that allow them to hover. Toydarians are often found as merchants and traders, and their unique physiology makes them immune to many forms of mind manipulation. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Trandoshan

special_qualities.name: Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Toughness as a bonus feat.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Limb Regeneration
special_qualities.description: You can regrow a lost limb in 1d10 days.

special_qualities.name: Natural Armor
special_qualities.description: You gain a +1 natural armor bonus to your Reflex Defense.

species_list.description_general: Trandoshans are a large, saurian humanoid species from Trandosha (or Dosha), known for their exceptional strength, regenerative abilities, and a culture centered around hunting (particularly Wookiees) to appease their goddess, the Scorekeeper. They possess tough, scaly hides, clawed hands, and keen senses, including darkvision. Trandoshans are often found as bounty hunters, mercenaries, and slavers. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Trianii

special_qualities.name: Acrobatic Prowess
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Acrobatics check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Natural Weapons (Claws)
special_qualities.description: When you make an unarmed attack, you may choose to use your claws, dealing 1d6 slashing damage.

special_qualities.name: Prehensile Tail
special_qualities.description: can effectively hold (but not wield) a Small or smaller item with its tail. When holding a Medium or larger item with its tail, encumbered and considered to be carrying a heavy load.

species_list.description_general: The Trianii are a feline humanoid species known for their agility, retractable claws, and long, prehensile tails. They hail from the Trian system and have a strong warrior tradition, organized into clans and ranger cadres. Trianii value honor, skill, and self-reliance, and are often found as explorers, scouts, or mercenaries. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Tusken Raider

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Stealth or Survival)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth or Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Tusken Raiders, or Sand People, are a nomadic and aggressive sentient species native to the desert planet Tatooine. They are known for their distinctive full-body wrappings and masks, their use of Banthas as mounts, and their fierce territoriality. Tusken culture is tribal and deeply intertwined with survival in the harsh desert environment. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Twi'lek

special_qualities.name: Deceptive
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Deception check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Great Fortitude
special_qualities.description: You gain a +2 species bonus to your Fortitude Defense.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

species_list.description_general: Twi'leks are a humanoid species originating from the planet Ryloth, easily recognizable by their twin head-tails called lekku, which are prehensile sensory organs. They come in a variety of skin colors and are known for their grace, cunning, and adaptability. Twi'lek culture is diverse, and they are found in many roles across the galaxy, from dancers and diplomats to smugglers and freedom fighters. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Ubese

special_qualities.name: Aggressive
special_qualities.description: If an Ubese character hits with a charge attack, the +2 bonus on attack rolls against the target persists for the duration of the encounter.

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Perception) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Perception skill.

special_qualities.name: Special Equipment (Environmental Suit and Breath Mask Requirement)
special_qualities.description: Ubese cannot tolerate the atmospheres of other worlds and must rely on breath masks to survive. Without a breath mask, an Ubese begins to suffocate. When not on their homeworld, Ubese wear environmental suits to stave of the hazards found on other planets as well as to hide their appearance. An environmental suit functions as a combat jumpsuit that also grants a +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense. The suit also includes a voice modulator to emulate the voice of a male or female or to mask the Ubese's gender. An Ubese environmental suit with breath mask and voice modulator costs 2,000 credits, and a year's supply of breathing filters cost 200 credits (50 credits on Ubese). Ubese characters begin with these items at no cost.

effects.details: Functions as combat jumpsuit, grants +2 equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense, includes voice modulator.
effects.starting_equipment_note: Begins play with these items at no cost.

special_qualities.name: Survival Instinct
special_qualities.description: You may choose to reroll any Survival check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: The Ubese are a humanoid species known for their nomadic warrior culture and their distinctive environmental suits and breath masks, which they wear due to their inability to tolerate most standard atmospheres. They are often secretive and xenophobic, with a reputation for being skilled mercenaries and assassins. Their homeworld, Uba IV, was environmentally devastated. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Ugnaught
species_list.description_general: Ugnaughts are a diminutive porcine humanoid species known for their hard work, technical skills, and stubbornness. They are often found in industrial settings, particularly in mining and manufacturing, and are skilled mechanics and engineers. Ugnaught society is communal, and they are native to Gentes, but many were enslaved and dispersed throughout the galaxy. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]
species_list.notes_for_processing: Original entry was 'Ugnaught (best guess)', retaining name as 'Ugnaught'.

species_list.name: Ugor

special_qualities.name: Amorphous Nature
special_qualities.description: As a full-round action, an Ugor can raise or lower any physical ability by a maximum of 5 points, but each point must be transferred from another similar ability (such as Str, Dex, and Con). Abilities cannot be altered more than 5 points above or below the Ugorâ€™s original scores. Bonuses and penalties (to skills, defenses, attacks, and so on) have to be adjusted accordingly.

effects.effect_description: Can reallocate points between STR, DEX, CON. Max change per ability is +/- 5 from original score. Total points remain constant among these three. Derived stats must be adjusted.

species_list.description_general: The Ugor are an amorphous, shape-shifting species capable of altering their physical forms. This unique physiology allows them to adapt their physical abilities by reallocating points between Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. They are often considered mysterious and their true nature can be difficult to ascertain. [Web Source: Based on common descriptions of amorphous species and provided traits.]
species_list.notes_for_processing: Original entry was 'Ugor (best guess)', retaining name as 'Ugor'.

species_list.name: Umbaran

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: Ignores concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.

special_qualities.name: Light Sensitivity
special_qualities.description: If you are exposed to bright light (such as sunlight), you're blinded for 1 round.

special_qualities.name: Low-Light Vision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (but not total concealment) from darkness.

effects.details: This is in addition to Darkvision, likely meaning they still function better in dim light than complete darkness compared to species with only Darkvision, or it's redundant if Darkvision covers all low-light scenarios.

special_qualities.name: Skills (Reroll Persuasion)
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Persuasion check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

special_qualities.name: Stealthy
special_qualities.description: You can reroll any Stealth check, but you must accept the result of the reroll (must take re-roll).

species_list.description_general: Umbarans are a pale-skinned, near-Human species from the shadowy planet Umbara, known for their ability to see in ultraviolet spectra and their often manipulative and subtle nature. They possess a hierarchical society and are skilled in espionage and political intrigue. Umbarans are typically sensitive to bright light but possess excellent darkvision and low-light vision. [Web Source: Wookieepedia]

species_list.name: Umbaran

special_qualities.name: Conditional Bonus Feat
special_qualities.description: You gain Skill Focus (Persuasion) as a bonus feat if you are trained in the Persuasion skill.

special_qualities.name: Darkvision
special_qualities.description: You ignore concealment (including total concealment) from darkness.
